List of all members.

Detailed Description

A collection of static functions that refer to the entire package (like version getters).

Definition at line 43 of file Global.h.

Member Function Documentation

int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::getVersion (  )  [static]

Returns a 64 bit version number for this library.

Returns:
a 64-bit integer version number for this library. The top 16 bits is the getVersionMajor() value. The next 16-bits are the getVersionMinor() value, and the last 32-bits are the getVersionRevision() value.

Definition at line 213 of file Global.cpp.

References getVersionMajor(), getVersionMinor(), and getVersionRevision().

00214   {
00215     return ((int64_t)getVersionMajor())<<48 | ((int64_t)getVersionMinor())<<32 | (int64_t)getVersionRevision();
00216   }

void com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::lock (  )  [static]

Performs a global-level lock of the XUGGLER library.

While this lock() is held, every other method that calls lock() in the same DLL/SO will block.

Use this sparingly. FFMPEG's libraries have few real global objects, but when they do exist, you must lock.

Lastly, if you lock, make damn sure you call unlock()

Definition at line 197 of file Global.cpp.

References init(), com::xuggle::ferry::Mutex::lock(), and mLock.

Referenced by com::xuggle::xuggler::Codec::findDecodingCodecByIntID(), com::xuggle::xuggler::Codec::findDecodingCodecByName(), com::xuggle::xuggler::Codec::findEncodingCodecByIntID(), and com::xuggle::xuggler::Codec::findEncodingCodecByName().

00198   {
00199     Global::init();
00200     if (sGlobal && sGlobal->mLock)
00201       sGlobal->mLock->lock();
00202   }

void com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::init (  )  [static]

Internal Only.

Do not call. Methods using the C++ interface that will not necessarily create other Global object should call this. In general, unless you're extending xuggler directly yourself, ordinary users of this library don't need to call this.

It's main purpose is to ensure any FFmpeg required environment initialization functions are called, and any Xuggler required environmental contexts are set up.

void com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::setFFmpegLoggingLevel ( int32_t  level  )  [static]

Internal Only.

This method can be used to turn up or down FFmpeg's logging level.

Parameters:
level An integer value for level. Lower numbers mean less logging. A negative number tells FFmpeg to shut up.

Definition at line 268 of file Global.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

const int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::NO_PTS = 0x8000000000000000LL [static]

A value that means no time stamp is set for a given object.

if the IMediaData#getTimeStamp() method of an object returns this value it means the time stamp wasn't set.

Definition at line 51 of file Global.h.

const int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::Global::DEFAULT_PTS_PER_SECOND = 1000000 [static]

The default time units per second that we use for decoded IAudioSamples and IVideoPicture objects.

This means that 1 tick of a time stamp is 1 Microsecond.

Definition at line 58 of file Global.h.

Referenced by com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::defaultPtsToSamples(), and com::xuggle::xuggler::IAudioSamples::samplesToDefaultPts().
